metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29662 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description: The Data::Validate::IP module through 0.29 for Perl does not properly consider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP address string, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the upstream patch only clarifies the documentation, there is actual behaviour change. Marking as negligible.

criterions.comment: libdata-validate-ip-perl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
